instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-5482 missing caps
threads.message: Hi there fellow techs, I have 820-5482 I/O board with blowing caps, are there schematics for the board or can anyone please tell me specs of them? 2 caps that are missing on [URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/23551-820-3462-short-on-pp5v_s4"]PP5V_S4[/URL] rail. [ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	image1.JPG Views:	1 Size:	600.8 KB ID:	23659" type="full" width="30%"]23659._xfImport[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-5482 missing caps
threads.message: They are just on the 5V line to the USB. I also see burn damage to the PCB. Just don't bother with this as there may be more damage than this. The board should even work just fine without the caps. This was probably caused by a voltage spike on the USB ports.
